definitions.definition: a small, dispersed amount of something.
examples: the scattering of freckles across her cheeks and forehead

definitions.definition: the process in which electromagnetic radiation or particles are deflected or diffused.

examples: scatter the coconut over the icing

definitions.definition: occur or be found at intervals rather than all together.
examples: there are many mills scattered throughout the marshlands

definitions.definition: (of a group of people or animals) separate and move off quickly in different directions.
examples: the roar made the dogs scatter

definitions.definition: cause (a group of people or animals) to separate and move off quickly in different directions.
examples: he charged across the foyer, scattering people

definitions.definition: cover (a surface) with objects thrown or spread randomly over it.
synonyms: disseminate; literarybestrew "the papers were scattered by the sudden breeze"

definitions.definition: deflect or diffuse (electromagnetic radiation or particles).
